segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 4
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 4

segments.pli: 19. Brāhmaṇavagga
segments.en: 19. Brahmins

segments.pli: 184. Abhayasutta
segments.en: 184. Fearless

segments.pli: Atha kho jāṇussoṇi brāhmaṇo yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṃ sammodi.
segments.en: Then the brahmin Jāṇussoṇi went up to the Buddha, and exchanged greetings with him.

segments.pli: Sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho jāṇussoṇi brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side and said to the Buddha:

segments.pli: “Ahañhi, bho gotama, evaṃvādī evaṃdiṭṭhi:
segments.en: “Master Gotama, this is my doctrine and view:

segments.pli: ‘natthi yo maraṇadhammo samāno na bhāyati, na santāsaṃ āpajjati maraṇassā’”ti.
segments.en: ‘All those liable to death are frightened and terrified of death.’”

segments.pli: “Atthi, brāhmaṇa, maraṇadhammo samāno bhāyati, santāsaṃ āpajjati maraṇassa;
segments.en: “Brahmin, some of those liable to death are frightened and terrified of death.

segments.pli: atthi pana, brāhmaṇa, maraṇadhammo samāno na bhāyati, na santāsaṃ āpajjati maraṇassa.
segments.en: But some of those liable to death are not frightened and terrified of death.

segments.pli: Katamo ca, brāhmaṇa, maraṇadhammo samāno bhāyati, santāsaṃ āpajjati maraṇassa?
segments.en: Who are those frightened of death?

segments.pli: Idha, brāhmaṇa, ekacco kāmesu avītarāgo hoti avigatacchando avigatapemo avigatapipāso avigatapariḷāho avigatataṇho.
segments.en: It’s someone who isn’t free of greed, desire, fondness, thirst, passion, and craving for sensual pleasures.

segments.pli: Tamenaṃ aññataro gāḷho rogātaṅko phusati.
segments.en: When they fall seriously ill,

segments.pli: Tassa aññatarena gāḷhena rogātaṅkena phuṭṭhassa evaṃ hoti:
segments.en: they think:

segments.pli: ‘piyā vata maṃ kāmā jahissanti, piye cāhaṃ kāme jahissāmī’ti.
segments.en: ‘The sensual pleasures that I love so much will leave me, and I’ll leave them.’

segments.pli: So socati kilamati paridevati, urattāḷiṃ kandati, sammohaṃ āpajjati.
segments.en: They sorrow and wail and lament, beating their breast and falling into confusion.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ kho, brāhmaṇa, maraṇadhammo samāno bhāyati, santāsaṃ āpajjati maraṇassa.
segments.en: This is someone who is frightened of death.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, brāhmaṇa, idhekacco kāye avītarāgo hoti avigatacchando avigatapemo avigatapipāso avigatapariḷāho avigatataṇho.
segments.en: Furthermore, it’s someone who isn’t free of greed, desire, fondness, thirst, passion, and craving for the body.

segments.pli: Tamenaṃ aññataro gāḷho rogātaṅko phusati.
segments.en: When they fall seriously ill,

segments.pli: Tassa aññatarena gāḷhena rogātaṅkena phuṭṭhassa evaṃ hoti:
segments.en: they think:

segments.pli: ‘piyo vata maṃ kāyo jahissati, piyañcāhaṃ kāyaṃ jahissāmī’ti.
segments.en: ‘This body that I love so much will leave me, and I’ll leave it.’

segments.pli: So socati kilamati paridevati, urattāḷiṃ kandati, sammohaṃ āpajjati.
segments.en: They sorrow and wail and lament, beating their breast and falling into confusion.

segments.pli: Ayampi kho, brāhmaṇa, maraṇadhammo samāno bhāyati, santāsaṃ āpajjati maraṇassa.
segments.en: This, too, is someone who is frightened of death.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, brāhmaṇa, idhekacco akatakalyāṇo hoti akatakusalo akatabhīruttāṇo katapāpo kataluddo katakibbiso.
segments.en: Furthermore, it’s someone who hasn’t done good and skillful things that keep them safe, but has done bad, violent, and corrupt things.

segments.pli: Tamenaṃ aññataro gāḷho rogātaṅko phusati.
segments.en: When they fall seriously ill,

segments.pli: Tassa aññatarena gāḷhena rogātaṅkena phuṭṭhassa evaṃ hoti:
segments.en: they think:

segments.pli: ‘akataṃ vata me kalyāṇaṃ, akataṃ kusalaṃ, akataṃ bhīruttāṇaṃ;
segments.en: ‘Well, I haven’t done good and skillful things that keep me safe.

segments.pli: kataṃ pāpaṃ, kataṃ luddaṃ, kataṃ kibbisaṃ.
segments.en: And I have done bad, violent, and corrupt things.

segments.pli: Yāvatā, bho, akatakalyāṇānaṃ akatakusalānaṃ akatabhīruttāṇānaṃ katapāpānaṃ kataluddānaṃ katakibbisānaṃ gati taṃ gatiṃ pecca gacchāmī’ti.
segments.en: When I depart, I’ll go to the place where people who’ve done such things go.’

segments.pli: So socati kilamati paridevati, urattāḷiṃ kandati, sammohaṃ āpajjati.
segments.en: They sorrow and wail and lament, beating their breast and falling into confusion.

segments.pli: Ayampi kho, brāhmaṇa, maraṇadhammo samāno bhāyati, santāsaṃ āpajjati maraṇassa.
segments.en: This, too, is someone who is frightened of death.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, brāhmaṇa, idhekacco kaṅkhī hoti vicikicchī aniṭṭhaṅgato saddhamme.
segments.en: Furthermore, it’s someone who’s doubtful, uncertain, and undecided about the true teaching.

segments.pli: Tamenaṃ aññataro gāḷho rogātaṅko phusati.
segments.en: When they fall seriously ill,

segments.pli: Tassa aññatarena gāḷhena rogātaṅkena phuṭṭhassa evaṃ hoti:
segments.en: they think:

segments.pli: ‘kaṅkhī vatamhi vicikicchī aniṭṭhaṅgato saddhamme’ti.
segments.en: ‘I’m doubtful, uncertain, and undecided about the true teaching.’

segments.pli: So socati kilamati paridevati, urattāḷiṃ kandati, sammohaṃ āpajjati.
segments.en: They sorrow and wail and lament, beating their breast and falling into confusion.

segments.pli: Ayampi kho, brāhmaṇa, maraṇadhammo samāno bhāyati, santāsaṃ āpajjati maraṇassa.
segments.en: This, too, is someone who is frightened of death.

segments.pli: Ime kho, brāhmaṇa, cattāro maraṇadhammā samānā bhāyanti, santāsaṃ āpajjanti maraṇassa.
segments.en: These are the four people liable to death who are frightened and terrified of death.

segments.pli: Katamo ca, brāhmaṇa, maraṇadhammo samāno na bhāyati, na santāsaṃ āpajjati maraṇassa?
segments.en: Who are those not frightened of death?

segments.pli: Idha, brāhmaṇa, ekacco kāmesu vītarāgo hoti vigatacchando vigatapemo vigatapipāso vigatapariḷāho vigatataṇho.
segments.en: It’s someone who is rid of greed, desire, fondness, thirst, passion, and craving for sensual pleasures.

segments.pli: Tamenaṃ aññataro gāḷho rogātaṅko phusati.
segments.en: When they fall seriously ill,

segments.pli: Tassa aññatarena gāḷhena rogātaṅkena phuṭṭhassa na evaṃ hoti:
segments.en: they don’t think:

segments.pli: ‘piyā vata maṃ kāmā jahissanti, piye cāhaṃ kāme jahissāmī’ti.
segments.en: ‘The sensual pleasures that I love so much will leave me, and I’ll leave them.’

segments.pli: So na socati na kilamati na paridevati, na urattāḷiṃ kandati, na sammohaṃ āpajjati.
segments.en: They don’t sorrow and wail and lament, beating their breast and falling into confusion.

segments.en: This is someone who’s not frightened of death.

segments.en: Furthermore, it’s someone who hasn’t done bad, violent, and corrupt deeds, but has done good and skillful deeds that keep them safe.

segments.pli: kataṃ kalyāṇaṃ, kataṃ kusalaṃ, kataṃ bhīruttāṇaṃ.
segments.en: And I have done good and skillful deeds that keep me safe.

segments.en: These are the four people liable to death who are not frightened and terrified of death.”

segments.pli: “Abhikkantaṃ, bho gotama, abhikkantaṃ, bho gotama … pe … upāsakaṃ maṃ bhavaṃ gotamo dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṃ saraṇaṃ gatan”ti.
segments.en: “Excellent, Master Gotama! … From this day forth, may Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”

segments.pli: Catutthaṃ.

suttaplex.blurb: Not everyone is afraid to die.
